summary: Lack of functionality for Linux environments

description: didn't expect to a see a microsft app integrated so well on linux

There's a lot of issues (especially on the privacy front) with Teams, but I doubt anyone here is looking at it because they want to. It's probably for work. In that case, it works fine. It does what you'd expect it too. Luckily, the Flatpak version does come sandboxed.
summary: It's there if you need it

description: Contrary to what the other review says, this application is not properly sandboxed. It uses devices=all, which effectively gives it access to your entire /dev/. This is likely due to wanting access to webcams. That said, it does seem to work as it should.
better use just browser version
Zero issues so far

I want to encourage Microsoft to release the whole Office 360 suite for Linux, and that is why I use this. I have a MSO-360 sub from my school, my work, and a personal account. They have it for IOS, Android, MacOS, but not Linux? ...It is a subscription, they are not losing money. Most Windows revenue comes from OEMs.
Everything seems to work as intended, screen sharing/video calling works, although notifications don't integrate with GNOME properly (they're separate, thanks Microsoft). Otherwise, it's fine.
App is still in preview, and works great on Fedora 32.
Everything is great but sometimes the window disappear from the window overview

As of the latest version everything works for me. I had problems with the previous version but they all seem to be fixed now. 

I can do group calls, group video, screen sharing, all the apps seem to be there, notification popups work and the timezone is set properly too!!
It works just fine, but we are talking about Micro$soft so i give one star!

I'm grateful for having this in the FOSS desktop at all, but support is not on par with the windows and OSX client.

- Regularly doesn't recognize USB devices
- Crashes on Wayland when screen sharing is used
- Crashes randomly
- Tries to use system trays on gnome. However system trays don't exist on gnome any more. As a result one has to change the default config if one wants to be able to close the programm.
Everything works great, would be nice to be able to share individual windows. Currently can only share entire screen.

It's much better and usable compare to skype/lync.
It's stop when I try to share screen on Fedora 32. Same computer running Manjaro work without problem when sharing screen.
summary: It works, but break when sharing screen on Fedora 32

description: Complains about missing canberra-gtk-module, which is not available by default on ClearLinux

Only issue is that screensharing doesn't work on Wayland, but that's more of an Electron issue than a Microsoft Teams issue. (Though it looks like Electron is very close to getting full Wayland support: electron/electron#10915)

I couldn't remove the configuration for opening at start up. Bad window sizing.

description: ...MS always pushing for the ultimate control despite UX.
summary: More broken than the browser version

description: Have been using this for almost a year now for attending online classes. Works well, only issue is the initial authentication process can be improvised.
My brain hurts because everytime I click on something I have to wait for teams. Using Markdown in the wiki pages is so slow, I consider to start using word instead. Plus no vim key binding support
Using it for Teams meetings on Ubuntu 20.04. No issues so far. Breakout rooms working. Keep it coming on Ubuntu!
summary: Trial version but successfully using it without issues. Recommend

description: After the update to 1.3.00.30857 I am redirected to web site to authenticate (as always) but after the positive authenticate I get still the same message that I need to register to Teams. I did it few months ago... sorry.....
Need to move to xorg for this to work with Screen sharing.

Microsoft Teams is a terrific platform for chat, snappier and less intrusive than Slack and easier to use and more widely used than open-source alternatives (which is important in an app of this type). The main issue is that the Linux app lags woefully behind the Mac and Windows versions in terms of features. The current version is at least a year out of date wrt features and needs to be upgraded. If you don't mind using old software, this is the best of what's available on Linux.
summary: Works well - lags behind Mac and Windows platforms

description: I can only see 4 people at a time. There is no together mode. Horrible for calls with more than 4 people. Windows users get updates a lot earlier than endless users. Do not recommend.

I had big problems running it with wayland and have to use X for video calls and screensharing, but it works great with X.

The big problem I have at the moment is that there is no way to open the developer tools while using the preview, on Windows or Mac users would click the tray icon, but we don't get that option. 

All things considered this is a good experience and I'm impressed. 
But I seriously need those dev tools.
summary: This app is pretty good, better than using a browser

description:
This software act like a malware. Stop forcing the autostart of it.

Uninstalled once for all.
summary: Autostart feature sucks, I uninstalled it

description:
In the description of this flatpak, it says the following:

NOTE: This wrapper is not verified by, affiliated with, or supported by Microsoft Corporation.

If you look at "Author" it says "Microsoft Corporation". 
Either it's MS or it isn't. Please tidy up this. It makes it seem very suspicious. Installed it only to add this "review", and will use the .deb untill this Flatpak is a bit more coherent in its author/disclaimer.
summary: Not verified or affiliated with MS corporation? What?

description: Uploaded files are always 0 bytes, no contents. No support for screen sharing in wayland (GNOME 40 and sway).
summary: Uploaded files have no contents, no screen sharing on wayland

description: So often crashes, stacking in process list. Not optimized ui, lags.

Annoying because no matter how many times I remove it from my start up applications list, it always magically reappears there after I restart my laptop.

Lacking features compared to the windows version like the ability to see more than 4 people at one time, or the ability to share your screen etc.

No virtual background
can't share screen

For the past week I have to uninstall and remove all left behind files because it refuses to show any kind of video in a call (other peoples web cams, shared screens, my own webcam preview, etc). Missing features that are in the windows app like what the other reviews say.

Yes, this Linux client for Microsoft Teams isn't the best. As of mid-July 2021 and through when this review is written, the video doesn't work for anyone, and all I can do is text or voice.

There are other options too. There is another community effort, but it hasn't seen an update for a year or so. Then you can also use a Chromium based browser to run it. Then you get video and sound. You can try in Firefox, but unfortunately, it doesn't work as well. It works, just not as snappy. 

Yes, this Linux "port" of the Teams application does really suck and it's missing a lot of features that MacOS and Windows get. Again, user bases, and other reasons, blah blah, it's Microsoft. They don't care, use the web app, and better yet, just use Microsoft Edge on Linux, it's based on Chromium now!

TL;DR;

does what it's supposed to, kind of. Video is janky, missing features, and the voice and text work alright.
summary: It's not perfect, nor great but functional

description: No way to enforce this pornography to start to work at ubuntu 20.04
summary: total sheet :D as everything what microsoft did in past or present

description: unable to use any account properly, continuous redirects to the website, requests to sign in, requests to enable teams for the account, but nothing works.
Works in the browser, but this "application" insists I am not signed up for Teams.

I hate all m$ products. They lack simplicity, logic. Like with logging into teams there are at least 6 redirects and finally Firefox is not supported... yes! but I wanted to use teams not firefox!
I can use Teams in Brave ... I can't login into teams app using brave because ... ASK MICRO$OFT. They did not tell me.

Installed Microsoft Teams Version 1.4.00.13653 (64-bit) from Flatpak on Ubuntu Budgie 21.04. Successfully able to sign in multiple times. Only issues I had regarding authentication and application loading was when I changed my password and needed to signout which resulted in a blank screen. Post password login authentication worked and am currently logged into Teams. Not sure if this information will help others but hopefully it will.
can't able to share screen on the .rpm version of microsoft teams preview, but .deb version it's working.
summary: can't able to share screen on fedora version of the app

description: The windows jumps around and works poorly.

after working for a while .. 
.... now it just kills itself after approx 5 minutes
Does what it does on every platform.

Scroll is unusable, impossible to review saved messages, no virtual background, is it event possible to imagine that in 2021 app of such a giant will perform in such disrespectful way... I would not put my app in the app store if it performed like that. Shame!
I need Teams all the time for my work, and I am glad it is on Linux. Forks flawlessly for me, so far.

Yeah, I know Electron apps typically take up a lot of resources but this thing sometimes makes the system super sluggish more than any other electron app in my library. Also, it's missing important features like the background blurring.
summary: Resource Hog - Use it for work if you must

description: Like described, missing screen share
summary: Everything works fine, but screenshare is not there

description:
Sound output is there, but the UI is stuck on 'connecting...'
Unusable, can't believe work relies on this.
Cannot share screen
It's crashing a lot during meetings. Sent a link on chat, crashed, tried to raise my hand, crashed.
When you reboot you get logged out
I can't get this app to load in Ubuntu 21 as of Jan 2022
Trying to upload a file gives you a error such as "This file is empty" or "This file is missing metadata".
Doesn't work for personal accounts, I keep getting the "this version of teams only supports work or school accounts managed by an organisation" screen not really useful for job interviews.
Works fine in Xorg, but on Wayland the window is not visible. Unusable.

description: Can't get access with my lousy paid 365 account. Only for buisnesses and schools. Why?
Worked better before the version 1.5 update
it sucks...stop hijacking my pc

Just installed it on Fedora using Flathub. Today we have the 1st May 2022.
- Had to set and reset the microphone. Even though it was set to the right one of my two microphones, I had to restart the entire computer to make it work.
- Desktop sharing does not work at all.
Solution:
Please test the software better. The current software testing sucks. Microsoft Teams is currently full of bugs! Hence, the user experience for this generaly quite capable software should be much better.
summary: Very bad software testing by Microsoft

description:
The whole application is weird. Everything is inconsistent, I changed my name once and it took days for the change to appear in some places, and months in others. It often has glitches like stuff not appearing for whatever reason, and the whole notification system is broken.

The flatpak isn't too different from a web browser - same thing just with notifications and background support.
summary: If I could give zero stars, I would

description: Sets offline status when i'm available. Its need to set up manually the available status.
poor audio and video quality. Very disappointed
Where is the version for personal use?
summary: Only Work and School account support

description:
Recently was taking minutes (minutes!) to start up, today it decided just not to render the UI. Other issues include:
- Conversations baloon menu renders asynchronously, often making me misclick on "pin message" rather than "reply".
- Wonky support for markdown text, making sharing code snippets a disaster.
- If I try a slightly more complex formatting (such as nested pointed lists), the whole formatting experience becomes buggy.
- Occasional crashes while videocalling
- Generally very slow UI
User hostile application

The version I tried lacks ability to select custom backdrop graphic or blur backgrounds. I would have preferred to use a dedicated client because I dont like leaving a browser open all the time. However, the browser version provided the features that were lacking in this "preview" desktop app version. On a positive note, the native Teams app for Linux did allow me to be contacted when my browser was closed. It is possible to run both versions at the some time but that can get a little confusing.
nothing more to say
Feels like microsoft is just holding back the features for their linux port. Heck even the webapp has more features (such as reactions) than this dump.

Doesn't allow non-organisation accounts.
Doesn't support 2 logins.
Typical Micro$hit app.

It seems like the app is now working on Wayland even though some reviews are saying the contrary and the metadata on the store too is saying it's unsafe. No problem yet.
Didn't get to try calls etc yet
My university mostly requires that we use this proprietary garbage for certain classes and I'm just venting a bit of frustration here. All of the problems microshit have are on full display.
No needs to install another piece of software, worse yet if you don't have a microsoft account. Just join meetings as a guest with Chrome browser.
summary: Better use the web app instead

description: Sloppy and unfinished, as everything Microsoft does
summary: Screen share doesn't work on wayland

description:
If you need background effects (blur, etc), you need to use the web client or the unofficial Teams client (which is a wrapped web client).

I guess Microsoft does not have the interest of really developping for Linux.

Zero acknowledgement from Microsoft that Wayland even exists, let along that it is becoming the default linux compositor, from the company which claims to embrace open source and support of Linux. The flatpak version saves files to a location in its container which is not your normal home directory file system, so even the packaging is not great.

Your best bet for Teams on Linux is Chrome official (not chromium), with pipewire features enabled (could be default by now).

Hat vor ein paar Monaten mal funktioniert. Jetzt ist es tot (Baut keine Verbindung mehr auf). Einzige Meldung:"Leider ist ein Problem aufgetreten". Das ist genauso hilfreich wie gar keine Fehlermeldung. Werde es deinstallieren.
Bricht bei der Verbindung zu MS Office ab, ich habe dass Gefühl, dass es nur meine Zugangsdaten abgreift

Leider recht alternativlos. Es fehlen nach wie vor wichtige Features (beispielsweise hintergrund blurring), Screen-sharing funktioniert nicht unter Wayland. Die Audiogeräteauswahl funktioniert nur mäßig...
Funktioniert wie es soll
Fine as long as it starts. Breaks frequently and can't be used to do anything if it does.
lags behind the funtionality of the windows version: still old user interface, no video backgrounds
summary: works ok, but could be better

description: It does what it is supposed to, but you can see that many components have been cobbled together for the most part. The performance leaves a lot to be desired and the GUI is different on each device, which makes the explaining of the interface or migration to an another device practically impossible.

Lacks behind regarding features (as video background or multi attendee view). Also changes my headphone and microphone configuration weirdly if I click on meeting links (from event invitations, for example).

In general this package is working mostly without issues. In my caes on EndeavourOS the logitech webcam could not be initialized. This is a minor issue and may related to flatpak on this platform.

But a major problem is the fact the uninstalling the pak does not delete the login information as well other local files, MS Teams is creating while running outside of the pak. Therefore be carefully using such software.
summary: Uninstalling does not delete old login and communication data

description: does not work under wayland which is default under fedora 35
KDE debe agregarle una foto en el escritorio
ha resultado muy útil para distintos equipos de trabajo, es muy avanzada en funcionalidades, muy buena para meetings online, entre otras funcionalidades que son muy buenas.
Recomendado para trabajar en estos tiempos de coronavirus, good job indeed
Aun le falta desarrollo, al intentar compartir pantalla en reuniones se reinicia, trabaja mejor en chrome
Intenté compartir la patalla en una reunión de trabajo y me bloqueó todo el sistema, sólo salía una pantalla negra. Tuve que reiniciar mi equipo.
Me permite ingresar a mi cuenta de TEAMS, porque usandola vía web me limitaba el uso del navegador.

La verdad no me gusta trabajar para una empresa, lo cual baja mi valoración al software, segundo, no siempre anda bien, a veces se cuelga de la nada, deberían darle mas soporte, y arreglar lo que permita "dar el control" a los otros... siempre a media todo en linux microsoft
summary: A medias como todo lo de Microsoft

description: es super mega geneal 8D

it worked fine for a couple of days, i was talking with a teacher and then the screen turned blank, tried to reinstall and when trying to login: blank screen again.... heck, i hate the fact that i'm even forced to use an MS product because is what's been choosen by our college, i always have issues with MS products, and this is a clear example of poor compatibility with other operating systems.
Falla el microfono en las conferencias (en la versión de escritorio funciona bien) y la auth con google falla...

Tengo una cuenta educativa en teams, que uso en la app del movil. Soy incapaz de que la app en el ordenador funcione. Cuando intento acceder a mi cuenta, no me deja, me dice que no estoy registrado. No se sincronizan las cuentas. siempre que quiero usar teams, via ordenador, tiene que ser en la web, porque la app en mi pc no va.
Desde que lo instalé, no he tenido ningún problema, se puede compartir pantalla y realizar todas las funciones necesarias.
Sólo sirve para organizaciones y a fuerza te manda a utilizar Chrome o Edge. Puto asco.
Todavía se puede mejorar, pero nos permite usarlo desde este OS
summary: Es bueno tener una versión para linux

description:
No es tan estable como la versión Windows, y no me permite utilizarlo en mi cuenta profesional.
Espero que progrese adecuadamente
Solo funciona para trabajo.

C'est vraiment parce que les autres (comme souvent) nous imposent leur solution, mais dieu que je m'en passerais :

- tolère mal la charge sur les grosses classes
- fichiers téléversés/chargés sur/depuis le service souvent corrompus !!
- rends tous les autres lecteurs muets même lorsqu'on remonte leur volume !
- plante sur Gnome-Shell si on change de bureau !

Félicitation Microsoft pour votre outil encore imposé de force et à la qualité inversement proportionnelle à votre budget lobying.

Essayé durant le confinement pour se connecter même quand mon PC pro était hors service, et ça fonctionne directement sans prise de tête. Reconnaissance de l'audio et de la caméra automatique, aucun soucis rencontré.

Pour un usage basique comme le mien, je ne note aucune différence avec le client Windows.
summary: Fait le job et le fait bien

description: Doesn't workns sent by mail for me with invitatio. Lots of error while trying to connect. No useful message to explain what gets wrong.
Не работают исходящие звонки на венду, только с венды на Линукс. При попытке демонстрации экрана стабильно вылетает. Наймите тестеров, что ли.
постоянно выбивает а еще и ошибку начинает показыватьпри входе, приходиться по 10 раз перезагружать телефон и ноутбук или удалять и скачивать наново

Программа работает в принципе нормально.
Но во время демонстрации экрана не виден курсор
Сколько не бился, микрофон так и не заработал, ни в гарнитуре, ни в вебке. И этот глюк одинаков при установке из пакета и при использовании flatpak
